content.body: So I just reported one of the weirdest bugs I ever encountered: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1781724
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: So I just reported one of the weirdest bugs I ever encountered: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1781724

content.body: In general, Gecko seems to have some fun quirks with string handling.. I have a vague feeling of having seen something very similar to this  this bug before

> <@ondr4s:matrix.org> So I just reported one of the weirdest bugs I ever encountered: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1781724

Will look, thanks, it's probably a weird interaction between JSString representation and our utf8 conversion code
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @ondr4s:matrix.org
So I just reported one of the weirdest bugs I ever encountered: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1781724
Will look, thanks, it's probably a weird interaction between JSString representation and our utf8 conversion code

content.body: emilio: FWIW, I suspect hsivonen (away from Matrix until 2022-08-08) will be able to identify the cause. He added some fast paths between JS and C++ that I would expect are the cause here.

content.body: Because UTF8String effectively behaved like the manual code
So either a bug in UTF8String, or a pre-existing issue / js engine bug or something.
Tho I think it'll probably have to wait till tomorrow because today I'm away from my laptop unexpectedly (hospital, but nothing bad)
Hey, if I have multiple dynamic script tags (dynamic as in created programatically) is their execution order guaranteed?
